notes: National park

name: Šibenik
notes: Gateway to Krka Falls

name: Split
notes: Major city, UNESCO palace

notes: Protected anchorage at Pakleni Islands; dinghy 10min to Hvar town for provisions & culture

name: Komiža
notes: Remote Vis island

name: Korčula
notes: Protected anchorage west of old town; dinghy to historic center, Marco Polo museum

name: Mljet
notes: National park

name: Dubrovnik
notes: UNESCO city walls

name: Herceg Novi
notes: Entry to Montenegro

name: Rose
cultureHighlight: Stone fishing village at Bay of Kotor entrance
notes: Quiet anchorage, pristine swimming, Venetian-era architecture

name: Perast
cultureHighlight: Our Lady of the Rocks & St. George islands
notes: UNESCO Bay of Kotor gem, baroque palaces, two island churches

name: Kotor
notes: UNESCO bay & town

name: Tivat
cultureHighlight: Naval Heritage Collection & Bay of Kotor views
notes: Protected anchorage in Bay of Tivat; dinghy to town for provisions, naval museum

name: Lustica Bay
notes: Sheltered bay, clear water, peninsula hiking trails

name: Bigova
notes: Sheltered bay popular for anchoring, excellent seafood

name: Budva
notes: Anchorage in Budva Bay; dinghy or swim to beach, walk to medieval Old Town & Citadela

name: Sveti Stefan
notes: Anchor in Przno/Milocer Bay, spectacular coastal scenery

name: Petrovac
notes: Scenic beach town, Roman mosaics nearby

name: Bar
notes: Anchorage off Bar; dinghy to port for provisions, taxi to Stari Bar ancient ruins (4km)

name: Ulcinj
notes: Last Montenegro stop

name: Shëngjin
notes: Entry to Albania; anchorage in bay, dinghy to beach & town for provisions

name: Durrës
notes: Historic port city

name: Karpen Beach
notes: Unspoiled beach anchorage south of Durrës

name: Vlorë
notes: Anchorage in Vlore Bay; protected from NW, dinghy to promenade & Independence Monument

name: Orikum
cultureHighlight: Albanian Riviera gateway & ancient Orikum ruins
notes: First dedicated Albanian yacht marina, sheltered bay in Vlorë Bay

name: Drymades Beach
notes: Dramatic cliff backdrop, crystal-clear water, excellent swimming

name: Himara
notes: Greek minority heritage, Livadhi beach, growing tourism hub

name: Porto Palermo
notes: Stunning natural harbor

name: Sarandë

name: Ksamil
notes: Final Albanian anchorage, stunning islets before crossing to Corfu

name: Kassiopi

notes: Protected anchorage at Kontokali Bay; dinghy or bus to Corfu UNESCO Old Town

name: Parga
notes: Picturesque town

name: Preveza
notes: Anchorage at Agios Thomas bay; protected, dinghy to Preveza town, visit Nicopolis ruins

name: Lefkada Town
notes: Anchorage near Lefkada town; good holding, dinghy to town center & beaches

name: Nydri
notes: Lively town

name: Fiskardo
notes: Last Ionian stop - head to Corinth

name: Messolonghi
notes: Anchorage in lagoon entrance; shallow draft area, dinghy to town - Lord Byron heritage

name: Patras
notes: Gateway to Gulf of Corinth

name: Galaxidi
notes: Charming port town

name: Corinth Canal
notes: Transit through canal to Saronic Gulf

name: Aegina
notes: Anchorage off Aegina town; protected, dinghy to fish market & Temple of Aphaea

name: Poros
notes: Anchorage in Poros channel; scenic waterfront, dinghy to town & Temple of Poseidon

name: Hydra
notes: No vehicles - donkeys only

name: Spetses
notes: Protected Baltiza inlet anchorage; dinghy to Spetses town, Bouboulina Museum, naval heritage

name: Cape Sounion
notes: Stunning anchorage at Cape Sounion; Temple of Poseidon sunset, swim ashore or dinghy

name: Kea
notes: First Cycladic island

name: Ermoupoli (Syros)
notes: Anchorage off Ermoupoli; good holding, dinghy to neoclassical Cyclades capital

name: Ornos Bay (Mykonos)
notes: Protected anchorage at Ornos Bay; sheltered from meltemi, bus to Mykonos town & windmills

name: Naxos
notes: Anchorage off Naxos town; protected N side, dinghy to iconic Portara & old town

name: Parikia (Paros)
notes: Anchorage in Parikia Bay; good holding, dinghy to Byzantine church & old town

name: Amorgos
notes: Unspoiled Cycladic gem, Big Blue filming location

name: Astypalaia
notes: Butterfly-shaped island

name: Kos
notes: Anchorage off Kos town; protected, dinghy to Hippocrates Tree & Asclepieion temple

name: Bodrum
notes: Entry to Turkey

name: Marmaris
notes: Anchorage in Marmaris Bay; very protected, dinghy to castle & waterfront bazaar

name: Gemiler Island (Fethiye)
notes: Stunning Gemiler Island anchorage; Byzantine church ruins on island, dinghy to Oludeniz beach

name: Kaş
notes: Diving & ancient ruins

name: Kekova
notes: Unique sunken ruins

name: Finike
notes: Anchorage in Finike Bay; protected, dinghy to town for provisions, visit Limyra ruins

name: Phaselis Bay (Kemer)
notes: Historic anchorage at Phaselis Bay; swim ashore to ancient Lycian ruins, crystal clear water

name: Antalya
notes: Major city, provisioning

name: Side
notes: Ancient Greek port city

name: Alanya
notes: Historic harbor

name: Anamur
notes: Last Turkey stop before Cyprus

name: Latchi
notes: First Cyprus stop, Akamas hiking, sea caves

name: Limassol
notes: Break up Latchi-Larnaca transit, provisioning

name: Larnaca
notes: Extended stay

name: Limassol
notes: Winter base - long-term stay

name: Paphos
notes: UNESCO mosaics

name: Limassol
notes: Brief stop en route to Larnaca

name: Larnaca
notes: Start return from Cyprus

name: Anamur
notes: Re-enter Turkey

name: Alanya
notes: Return route

name: Side
notes: Return visit - ancient ruins

name: Antalya
notes: Return provisioning

name: Finike
notes: Return route; anchorage in Finike Bay, visit Limyra & Arycanda ruins

name: Kaş
notes: Return route

name: Kastellorizo
notes: Greek island 2km off Turkey coast

name: Lindos (Rhodes)
cultureHighlight: Acropolis of Lindos & Medieval Old Town
notes: Stunning Lindos Bay anchorage; walk to ancient Acropolis, whitewashed village, bus to Rhodes Old Town UNESCO

name: Chalki
notes: Peaceful Dodecanese island

name: Karpathos
notes: Between Turkey and Crete

name: Kasos
notes: Traditional seafaring island

name: Sitia
notes: Anchorage in Sitia Bay; protected, dinghy to charming town, visit Toplou Monastery & Vai palms

name: Agios Nikolaos
notes: Charming harbor town

name: Heraklion
notes: Minoan palace - must visit

name: Rethymno
notes: Anchorage off Rethymno; calm conditions required, dinghy to Venetian old town & Fortezza

name: Chania
notes: Western Crete - head to Kythira

name: Kapsali (Kythira)
notes: Very protected Kapsali Bay anchorage; twin beaches, walk up to Chora Castle

name: Gytheio
notes: Ancient port of Sparta

name: Kalamata
notes: Anchorage in Kalamata Bay; good holding, dinghy to town for olives, old town & railway park

name: Pylos
notes: Site of Battle of Navarino

name: Katakolo
notes: Anchorage at Katakolo; calm conditions, taxi to Ancient Olympia UNESCO site (35km)

name: Zakynthos
notes: Anchorage in Zakynthos harbor; protected, dinghy to town, boat trip to Navagio Beach

name: Argostoli
notes: Anchorage in Argostoli Bay; good holding, dinghy to Kefalonia capital, sea turtles

name: Sivota (Lefkada)
notes: Very protected anchorage at Sivota; charming village, tavernas, walk to provisions

name: Gaios (Paxos)
notes: Anchorage between islets at Gaios; stunning setting, dinghy to charming village & Blue Caves

name: Corfu
notes: Last Greece stop - prepare for Italy crossing

name: Othoni
notes: Northwesternmost Greek island

name: Santa Maria di Leuca
notes: Italy landfall - heel of boot

name: Gallipoli
notes: Anchorage off Gallipoli; protected bay, dinghy to stunning Baroque island old town

name: Taranto
notes: Ancient Greek colony

name: Policoro
notes: Modern Marinedi marina, Gulf of Taranto

name: Sibari
notes: Large marina complex in Gulf of Taranto

name: Rossano
notes: Byzantine heritage town

name: Crotone
notes: Ancient Magna Graecia

name: Le Castella
notes: Iconic anchorage at Le Castella; stunning views of Aragonese sea fortress, swim to castle

name: Roccella Ionica

name: Reggio Calabria
notes: Strait of Messina, famous Greek bronzes

name: Giardini Naxos

name: Syracuse

name: Marina di Ragusa
cultureHighlight: Baroque towns of Val di Noto
notes: Final stop - end of journey
